benchmark_details.name: KGQuiz
benchmark_details.overview: KGQuiz is a scalable framework to comprehensively investigate the knowledge generalization abilities of large language models across three knowledge domains and five tasks with increasing complexity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the knowledge abilities of large language models across varying complexity of tasks and knowledge domains.

data.source: Generated from triplet-based knowledge graphs from three diverse domains: commonsense, encyclopedic, and biomedical.
data.annotation: Automatically generated questions from knowledge graphs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model outputs compared to the ground truth defined in the knowledge graphs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in knowledge retrieval and generalization tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation involved extensive evaluations of model outputs against generated knowledge.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy concerns may arise from sensitive information contained in knowledge graphs.
